select1.hint: If you have already taken a measurement with this smartphone select "No."
If you are currently a student with part time job select student.

input.hint: Write "Environmental Science Student" if you currently study environmental science.

select1.hint: If you are currently studying environmental science at the bachelor's level select bachelor's.

input.hint: If your GPS doesn't autosave, please wait for at least a few minutes prior to manually saving to ensure high accuracy GPS coordinates.

select1.hint: Spring source measurements should be within 100 meters of where the spring water comes out of the ground. If possible, springs should be measured upstream of any diversions. If this is not possible, please indicate that there are known diversions upstream in the previous question.
A mainstem is the largest stream within 500 meters of the measurement site. A tributary is a stream that joins a larger stream (e.g. mainstem) within 500 meters of the measurement site.

input.hint: Measurement ID can be used to link ODK records with other ODK records or external analyses (e.g. isotopes, etc.)
Enter the total number of stations you are measuring!
Measurements should be performed at even intervals from right bank to left bank (when looking downstream).
Ensure that the meter scale doesn't move vertically when twisting. Depending on water velocity, this depth should be slightly higher than the previous depth.
Stream width should be the total distance from the left to the right edge of water in a direction perpendicular to flow.
Enter the total number of stations you are measuring!
Measurements should be performed at even intervals from right bank to left bank (when looking downstream).
Stream width should be the total distance from the left to the right edge of water in a direction perpendicular to flow.
A coefficient of 0.8 is used to account for differences between surface velocity and mean channel velocity.
Enter the total number of individual springs regardless of whether they are flowing or not!
Measurements should be performed from left to right when looking at the streams from the front. Enter 0 for volume and time if the specific stone spout is not flowing.
Enter 0 if not flowing.
Enter 0 if not flowing.
For example, "Weir" or "Flume."

upload.hint: Notes should include all information needed to calculate calibration constant (k)!

input.hint: See Moore 2005 (Slug Injection Using Salt in Solution) for details! This can also be added by S4W-Nepal staff after analysis of the data.
This is the value of stream EC meter prior to adding any salt!
This is only a recommendation! If only certain amounts of salt are available (e.g. 100 g packets), the closest possible amount should be entered on the following screen.
Stir the salt water solution until all salt is dissolved (invisible)! This may take several minutes!
This is the point in the river where you will inject your salt solution!
Avoid stream reaches with large amounts of slow moving pools on the edges. A run with good mixing is the ideal reach!
This is the place in the river where you will be recording your video of EC!

upload.hint: Video should be roughly 5 minutes long or until EC returns to background levels!

input.hint: This should only be edited by S4W-Nepal staff after review of the data! This will be blank if performing a salt dilution measurement.
This should only be edited by S4W-Nepal staff after review of the data!

select1.hint: For example, click yes if your gauge has been damaged, if you have a question, or want more information about S4W-Nepal!

upload.hint: For example, take a picture of a broken gauge.
